title: Gruppchef IT
description:
**| Skandia | Stockholm**
 Du kommer att ansvara för en grupp medarbetare som arbetar med utveckling och förvaltning av Skandias affärsgemensamma applikationer, primärt inriktat mot CRM och Kund.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att leda, planera samordna, följa upp och utveckla arbetet inom dina team i nära samarbete med den produktledning som ansvarar för prioriteringar av teamens leverans. Du och dina medarbetare kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med andra enheter på Skandia och att skapa ett helhetsperspektiv kommer att vara av yttersta vikt framåt. Rollen innefattar även ett funktionsansvar för ett antal applikationsportföljer.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i ledningsgrupp för Koncern- och Affärsgemensamt IT och rapportera till Jesper Bengtsson, Chef IT.
   

  

**Hos oss får du möjligheten att...**
* Coacha medarbetare inom enheten.
* Proaktivt bygga förtroende med intressenter relevanta för enhetens arbete och måluppfyllelse.
* Medverka vid affärsplanering för din specifika del av verksamheten.
* Bidra till utveckling och framdrift mot överordnade enhetsplaner och eventuellt verksamhets-/funktionsplaner för att säkra Skandias långsiktiga framgång.


**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att...**
 Du som chef tror på ett ledarskap där engagemang och tydlighet är hörnstenar för att säkerställa det bästa för våra medarbetare, för dig och för våra kunder. Vi förväntar oss ett ledararskap där du är modig, prioriterar och tar ansvar proaktivt. Ett handlingskraftigt förhållningssätt är nyckeln till framgång. Som ledare hos oss kommer du att inspirera- och utmana din omgivning med en förmåga att lyssna, bry dig om och engagera andra.
   

  

 Du präglas av en nyfiken inställning som fokuserar på lärande och utveckling. Klar och transparent kommunikation är avgörande. Du kommer förväntas sätta tydliga förväntningar, följa upp, och aktivt söka feedback för att ständigt förbättra både processer och resultat.
   

  

* Tidigare chefs- och ledarerfarenhet med funktionsansvar.
* God kommunikatör med stor samarbetsförmåga.
* God förmåga att skifta perspektiv såväl strategiskt som operativt.
* Har kunskap inom Dynamics och Marketing Automation.
* God förståelse för SAFe som agilt ramverk.
* Kan kommunicera flytande på svenska både i tal och skrift.


 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**I och med semestern påbörjas urvalet i augusti.**

title: IT Service Owner
description:
Scania, as a brand in the Traton Group, is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. Scania also has the lead in the Traton Group securing IT’s modular system across all brands. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

 We are seeking an experienced and motivated IT Service Owner to join our team on our journey towards Zero Trust. In this critical role, you will manage and optimize our Scania Network IT services, ensuring they meet business needs and deliver maximum value. As we strive for best-in-class network stability, visibility, and automation, your strategic thinking, strong leadership skills, and deep understanding of IT service management principles will be essential. Extensive knowledge of Cisco products is also important for this position. Join us and help shape the future of our network infrastructure.
   

  

**Your role as IT Service Owner**
* Define and manage the vision, strategy, and roadmap for IT Network services.
* Ensure that our IT Network services align with business objectives and deliver expected outcomes.
* Collaborate with stakeholders, including Product Owners, Architects, and Line Managers, to understand enterprise requirements and translate them into service features and enhancements.
* Oversee the entire lifecycle of our IT services, from design and implementation to ongoing maintenance and improvement, making adjustments as necessary.
* Manage service performance to ensure high availability, reliability, and scalability.
* Participate in incident and problem management efforts, including root cause analysis and the implementation of corrective actions and processes.
* Develop and maintain service-level agreements (SLAs) and key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure service performance and drive continuous improvement with our Managed Service partners.
* Coordinate with cross-functional teams, including IT operations, development, and support, to ensure seamless service delivery.
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices, incorporating them into service management processes in collaboration with our Product Owners, Managers, and Solution Architects.


**Your profile**
 A Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or equivalent experience is required, along with experience in IT Service Management or a similar role. Strong knowledge of ITIL or other IT service management frameworks is essential, as is a proven track record of managing complex IT services in a dynamic business environment. Solid leadership and communication skills, along with the ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams and stakeholders across multiple organizational and geographical areas within the company, are crucial. Additionally, very good problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to addressing issues are needed. The ability to listen and learn is important, as is expertise in Cisco Networking.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 Enjoy competitive salaries, flexible working hours, and access to educational programs for skill development. As a Scania employee, perks includes car leasing possibilities, performance bonuses, parental benefits, and access to various sports clubs. Plus, if you're in Stockholm, hop on our Scania Job Express for a direct commute between Stockholm and Södertälje, or work from offices right next to Sergels torg in central of Stockholm city.
   

  

**Further information**
 If you have any questions about the position contact hiring manager Martin Breslin, martin.breslin@scania.com. For more information about the recruitment process, contact Shala Jamshid, Shala.Jamshid@scania.com , Talent Acquisition Specialist. A background check might be conducted on the final candidate. Due to the upcoming holiday season, we will begin the process after the end of week 32. Thank you for your understanding and patience during this time.

title: Customer Service Specialist
description:
Vill du arbeta med kundservice i ett snabbt växande IT-företag och är du en strukturerad och empatisk lagspelare? Då kan du vara vår nya kollega!
 




**Om oss** 





 BostadsPortal är ett snabbt växande företag där vi hjälper vi hyresvärdar och bostadssökande att hitta varandra. Kundservice är en central del av vår verksamhet och det värde vi levererar till våra användare. Vårt team är ansiktet utåt och erbjuder dagligt stöd till bostadssökande samt privata och professionella hyresvärdar. 
 





 Vi förser också våra kollegor inom produkt-, utvecklings- och marknadsavdelningarna med värdefulla insikter och samarbetar nära med säljteamet för att säkerställa att våra största kunder får bästa möjliga service.
 




**Arbetsuppgifter** 




  




* Kundrelationer: Bygga och underhålla positiva och långsiktiga relationer med kunder genom regelbunden kommunikation och engagemang för både B2B såsom B2C.
* Du kommer även att ansvara för vårt supportcenter och medverka till att rätt information och innehåll finns tillgängligt. Vilket kommer innebära arbete med både text och bild
* Stödja kunden vid implementering av nya produkter och tjänster: Stödja och guida kunder för att säkerställa en smidig start med produkter eller tjänster från ditt företag.
* Användarutbildning: Tillhandahålla utbildning och resurser för att öka kundens kunskap och effektivitet vid användning av produkter eller tjänster.
* Genomföra kundutvärderingar: Samla in och analysera kundens feedback för att förstå deras behov och förväntningar och överföra insikter till produkter och tjänster.
* Förnyelse och expansion: Identifiera möjligheter för att utveckla kundens affär eller våra tjänster och service




 Du kommer också att arbeta proaktivt med merförsäljning på hyresvärdarnas annonser och ge support på våra kompletterande tjänster som hyreskontrakt och flyttbesiktningar etc. En viktig del av ditt arbete blir att manuellt validera alla annonser och onboarda nya hyresvärdar så att de är väl förberedda för att hantera sin uthyrning.
 




**Kvalifikationer** 




  




* Erfarenhet: 
 

 Minst 2-4 år erfarenhet 
 

 av operativa kundrelationer, kundservice och/eller försäljning.
* Utbildning: Högskoleutbildning inom 
 

 företagsekonomi, kommunication, marknadsföring, eller närbesläktade områden, eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Kommunikationsfärdigheter: Utmärkta skriftliga och muntliga kommunikationsfärdigheter för att effektivt samarbeta med kunder och internt.
* Relationsbyggande: Förmåga att bygga och underhålla starka relationer med olika kundprofiler.
* Resultatorienterad: Driven att uppnå och överträffa kundens förväntningar och bidra till såväl kundens som det egna företagets tillväxt.



**Vem är du?** 





 Vi söker dig som har följande egenskaper och färdigheter:
 




 - Energisk och positiv inställning till arbete
 



 - Empatisk och tålmodig
 



 - Starka kommunikativa färdigheter och förmåga att anpassa dessa efter kundens behov
 



 - Flytande svenska och god engelska
 



 - Strukturerad och ansvarsfull
 



 - Initiativrik och förmåga att anpassa generella riktlinjer till specifika lösningar
 



 - God lagspelare som tar ansvar för både kollegor och företagets mål
 



 - Flexibel när det gäller arbetstider
 



**Vi erbjuder** 





 Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med möjligheter till personlig och professionell utveckling. Din trivsel är viktig för oss, och vi satsar på individuella samtal och utvecklingsplaner för att säkerställa din framgång hos oss och i din framtida karriär.
 




**Ansökan** 





 Är du vår nya kollega? Skicka din motiverade ansökan, CV och eventuella referenser via länken:
 





 ﻿
 
 https://candidate.hr-manager.net/ApplicationInit.aspx?cid=1444&ProjectId=143985&DepartmentId=20013&MediaId=4617
 
 Förväntad start i sep-okt 2024. Sista ansökningsdag är den 15 aug.
 





 PS! Vi går på semester i juli och en bit in i augusti så bli inte orolig ifall du uppfattar det som ”tyst” ifrån oss under den här perioden. Vi ses sommarbruna och utvilade efter sommaren 
 





 Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Mathias Lindsäth på via e-post: 
 
 mathias.lindsath@bostadsportal.se
 
 .

title: Expert IT Security Specialist
description:
**Job ID: 25397** 
  
 




  
 





 At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and are deeply committed to meet them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re are working in an environment where we are creating and harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.  
 





  
 





**Are you our new Senior IT Security and Risk Advisor?** 






  
 





 We are looking for a Senior IT Security and Risk Advisor to consult on topics within the Identity and Access management (IAM) area and support in related security activities in the bank. This is an opportunity for you to work within a diverse and complex area and influence the future security solutions.
 





  
 





**About this opportunity** 








 Welcome to the IAM Governance and Strategy team where we protect and de-risk the bank within Identity-, Access- and Privileged Access management. We add value by securing and maturing the bank IAM/IGA posture, continuously improving and safeguarding our customers data against potential threats and misuse.  As a senior IT security and risk advisor you will have an important role in ensuring that current and future security issues within IAM are handled in an appropriate and secure manner corresponding to the current and upcoming demands.
 





  
 





**What you will be doing:** 





* Provide IAM security and risk advisory to IAM leaders and stakeholder teams across Nordea
* Assess, identify and implement new security controls on various projects across the bank
* Review coverage and effectiveness of existing information security controls
* Perform gap analyses of our adherence to information security control frameworks (NIST as the primary)
* Perform risk management activities from the initial identification throughout assessment and identifying mitigating actions
* Review existing guidelines and instructions and update/create where gaps exists
* Represent Identity and Access Management in QRA’s
* Assist in major vendor assessments and contractual negotiations representing IAM  requirements



  
 




 The position can be located in Stockholm, Helsinki, Gdynia or Warsaw.
 




  
 





**Who you are** 








 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we expect you to share with us.   
 





  
 





**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Have 3+ years of experience working with various Information Security disciplines
* Have 5+ years of experience IT infrastructure experience
* Enjoy taking part in development of new services/capabilities with a focus on making them secure
* Have previous experience from either a similar role or consulting company
* Are ambitious and self-driven and fuelled by delivering high quality changes
* Are able to lead and drive other stakeholders
* Thrive as a workshop facilitator and enjoy bringing your own expertise to play
* Personally lead by example using Nordea’s vision, values and leadership statement



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps** 






  

  



 Welcome to apply by submitting your application no later than August 30/08/2024
 



 . Please be informed that applications will be reviewed continuously and interviews might also be conducted during this time. Kindly also note that a background check might be conducted. 
 





  
 





 For more information, you are welcome to reach out to Lasse Berget, Lasse.Berget@nordea.com. 
 





  
 



**Only for candidates in Poland:**


 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 







  
 







 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 







  
 







 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: 
 



 https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf
 







  
 







 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Cloud Network Architect / Engineer
description:
Har du erfarenhet av att jobba med nätverk och cloud? Vi söker nu en Cloud Network Architect / Engineer till Vings IT avdelning!
 



  





 Brinner du för nätverk och cloud? Vill du arbeta i en händelserik miljö och vara med och utforma framtiden inom nätverk? Då vill vi höra från dig! Vi vill satsa på området och söker därför flera personer till vårt Cloud Infrastructure Team.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som Cloud Network Architect/Engineer kommer du att vara med och driva arbetet inom nätverk framåt, Ving befinner sig i en stor transformationsresa in i molnet och här blir du en viktig del. I rollen kommer du att ha en framåtblick och omvärldsbevaka ny teknik samtidigt som du arbetar hands-on med allt från att implementera lösningar till att supportera utvecklingsteam gällande nätverksfrågor.
 



  





 Du kommer ingå i teamet Technology Services som ansvarar för ett modernt private cloud-datacenter byggt på Microsoft-teknologi, Azure public cloud-lösningar med tyngden på SaaS och PaaS lösningar. Teamet strävar efter att ständigt förbättras och du kommer ges stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
 



  





 Som Cloud Network Architect/Engineer kommer du att arbeta med att ta fram och driva roadmap för nätverk samt implementera och underhålla lösningar i både Azure och Onprem miljöer. Detta kommer bland annat innebära att:
 


* Designa, standardisera, underhålla och leverera nätverks plattformar i molnet och on-prem
* Vara drivande i arbetet inom arktiektur och roadmap för nätverk och i vår molnresa
* Samarbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team för att anpassa nätverkslösningar utifrån verksamhetens behov.
* Felsökning och problemlösning av tjänster och implementering av nya lösningar
* Guida och supportera verksamhet och utvecklingsteam i nätverksrelaterade frågor



  





**Vem vi söker** 




  





**Vi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:** 



* Högskoleutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom IT fokuserade på molnlösningar och arkitektur, företrädesvis med Microsoft Azure
* Kunskap om Microsofts teknologistack för både privata och offentliga molntjänster
* Kunskap inom Azure Networking, Data centre network, SD-WAN, Network Security



  





**Det är meriterande om du även:** 



* Är certifierad inom IT arkitektur (ex. TOGAF, COBIT)
* Har kunskap inom Infrastructure as Code (IaC), ARM/Bicep, automatisering
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt



  





 Vi söker dig som har sinne för struktur, är noggrann och analytisk. Du tar självständiga initiativ och är en analytisk problemlösare som har förmågan att se saker ur ett helhetsperspektiv och förstå samband mellan detalj och helhet. Du är bra på problemlösning och har lätt att knyta relationer för goda samarbeten. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet till en intern karriär. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete mellan de nordiska länderna för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!
 



 Vi är en arbetsplats med ett stort kunnande och en drivkraft att hela tiden bidra till att förbättra vår verksamhet. Vi är ett företag där vi har roligt och bryr oss om varandra med vårt people promise "it should be fun, developing and rewarding doing a good job".
 



  





**Om Ving** 




 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernen Nordic Leisure Travel Group. I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Urval sker löpande, så vi välkomnar din ansökan så snart som möjligt. I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Ving med Boxhill AB. Vill du veta mer, kontakta gärna ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Petra Törnblom, petra.tornblom@bhill.se
 



  





 🏄‍♂️ Kul på jobbet, 🤝 Tjänstepension, 🌎 Reseförmåner, 🦉 Utveckling och lärande, 💗 Well-being, 💼 Hybrid arbetsplats - Läs mer om vad vi erbjuder här

title: Management Consultant within Financial Crime
description:
**Company Description**
 We believe in the power of ingenuity to build a positive human future.
   

  

 As strategies, technologies and innovation collide, we create opportunity from complexity.
   

  

 Our diverse teams of experts combine innovative thinking and breakthrough use of technologies to progress further, faster. Our clients adapt and transform, and together we achieve enduring results.
   

  

 An innovation and transformation consultancy, we are over 4000 specialists in consumer and manufacturing, defence and security, energy and utilities, financial services, government and public services, health and life sciences, and transport. Our people are strategists, innovators, designers, consultants, digital experts, scientists, engineers and technologists.
   

  

 We operate globally from offices across the UK, US, Netherlands and Nordics.
   

  

*PA. Bringing Ingenuity to Life*
* We work in a hybrid model at PA, but your work base will be aligned to our Stockholm office and be within easy travel distance.
* Travel to the client’s site will be necessary as and when the client requires
* Fulltime
* Application deadline: ASAP


**Job Description**
**Financial Crime Prevention** 
**at PA**
 Our financial crime prevention experts have led some of the most exciting work that the consulting industry has seen in building leading Financial Crime intelligence functions. We have helped global regulators to become more sophisticated and data-driven in their AML/CFT supervision and enforcement as well as supporting the delivery of transaction monitoring engines driven by next-generation technologies. By blending PA’s rich history in consulting with our technology culture and capabilities, we mix disciplines, deliver faster, iterate smarter and constantly learn — challenging the status quo to seek the best solution for our clients.
   

  

 You will be working with our diverse and high performing delivery teams transforming FC risk management frameworks, crafting and implementing technologies across customer onboarding, payment screening and TM. You will also liaise with senior client stakeholders in drafting policy to help to prevent, detect and investigate money laundering, terrorist financing, ABC, fraud and market abuse.
   

  

**Here are two different examples of recent PA projects**
 Our financial crime prevention team recently undertook an engagement for a large Nordic bank. The Covid-19 economic relief measures unfortunately have attracted both criminals and legitimate claimants alike. The challenge now was for the bank to differentiate between legitimate applicants and fraudsters. PA was able to rapidly break down a seemingly insurmountable task and we solved the client's problem with limited resources. We identified high-risk customers, and they were investigated and reported – in some cases leading to seizure of funds and exit of customers. Strategies and tools built for this project were also used by the bank in other areas within financial crime investigations.
   

  

 For another large Nordic Bank, we helped merge country specific KYC policies into one global policy. The challenge was to ensure a policy that was standardized, detailed and specific, but yet allow for substantive differences between countries. This involved working with first line and compliance teams across multiple countries to develop agreed upon definitions, processes, and governance. The result was a streamlined and standardized set of policies that was useful and laid the foundation to standardize the KYC data set, processes and ultimately the technology.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**About You**
 We are looking for consultants with 2-3 years of experience from a similar consultancy or project work who want to be part of our Risk & Regulation team. We are looking for candidates who have experience in either risk management, compliance and regulation or combating financial crime. In particular but not limited to;
   

  

  

* Financial crime risk management frameworks, Enterprise Risk Assessment, Customer Due Diligence, monitoring and screening
* KYC and financial crime prevention process design
* Delivering new technologies across customer onboarding, payments screening and transaction monitoring
* Prevention, detection and investigation of money laundering, terrorist financing, sanctions, bribery and corruption, fraud, and market abuse
* Sourcing and/or implementing vendor software for financial crime prevention
* Designing and working with three lines of defence
* Transaction Monitoring model creation, testing and validation


 You should be:
   

  

  

* Fluent in business level Swedish and English.
* Excellent in communication skills, both spoken and written.
* Ready to dig into details (like reading regulation) but be good at seeing the big picture.
* Able to work on your own at a client’s or be part of a team.
* Previous management consulting experience is a plus.
* Please note you must already have the unconditional right to live and work in Sweden. We welcome international applications, but we are unable to offer sponsorship for work permits, so you will need to have the full right to live and work in Sweden.


**The Offer**
 We offer the opportunity to work on purposeful projects with incredible people, competitive salary, pension and bonus scheme, clear pathways to progression, and a thriving learning culture.
   

  

**Benefits**
**Additional Information**
 Life At PA encompasses our peoples' experience at PA. It's about how we enrich peoples’ working lives by giving them access to unique people and growth opportunities and purpose led meaningful work.
   

  

 We believe diversity fuels ingenuity. Diversity of thought brings exciting perspectives; diversity of experience brings a wealth of knowledge, and diversity of skills brings the tools we need. When we bring people together with diverse backgrounds, identities, and minds, embracing that difference through an inclusive culture where our people thrive; we unleash the power of diversity – bringing ingenuity to life.
   

  

 Find out more about Life at PA here.
   

  

 We are dedicated to supporting the physical, emotional, social and financial well-being of our people. Check out some of our extensive benefits:
   

  

  

* 33 days annual leave
* Company pension scheme
* Annual performance-based bonus
* Consistent training, development, and career progression
* It’s an environment that is energetic and fast-paced, that values collaboration, curiosity and treating people fairly


 We recruit, retain, reward and develop our people based solely on their abilities and contributions and without reference to their age, background, disability, genetic information, parental or family status, religion or belief, race, ethnicity, nationality, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity (or expression), political belief veteran status, or other by any other range of human difference brought about by identity and experience. We are on a journey towards ensuring our workforce is diverse at all levels and that our firm is representative of the world around us. We welcome applications from underrepresented groups.
   

  

**Adjustments or accommodations** 
 - Should you need any adjustments or accommodations to the recruitment process, at either application or interview, please contact us.
   

  

**Please apply by submitting your CV and a short cover letter motivating your interest for the role, PA and management consulting as soon as possible. Selection and interviews are ongoing. If you have any questions, please get in touch with Sanna Austrell sanna.austrell@paconsulting.com**

title: Senior VMware Technician
description:
**Job Description**
 Vi söker en Senior VMware Tekniker med Fokus på Windows, Active Directory, PowerShell och Python Skriptning samt Automation för att stärka vårt team och ta ansvar för att optimera och hantera vår virtualiseringsmiljö.
   

  

 Som en viktig medlem av vårt IT-team kommer du att fokusera på VMware-miljön, Windows-system, Active Directory samt skriptning i PowerShell och Python för att automatisera och effektivisera våra processer. Vi söker en självgående individ med stark problemlösningsförmåga, god kommunikationsförmåga och förmågan att arbeta i en internationell och dynamisk miljö.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Hantera och optimera virtualiseringsmiljön med fokus på VMware.
* Arbeta med Windows-servermiljöer och Active Directory.
* Arbeta med Powershell och Python för att automatisera och effektivisera arbetsprocesser.
* Driva och implementera automatiseringslösningar för att förbättra hanteringen av infrastrukturtjänster och processer.
* Ansvara för övervakning och prestandaoptimering av system och servrar.
* Samarbeta med globala leveranscenter i Europa för att säkerställa enhetlig leverans och support.
* Arbeta med ärendehanteringssystemet ServiceNow för att spåra och lösa problem.
* Följ ITIL-processen i dagliga arbetsuppgifter.
* Designa, implementera, felsöka, hantera och utveckla våra kunders VMware-plattformar och IT-infrastruktur.
* Uppdatera, migrera och underhålla VMware-miljöer.


**För att lyckas och trivas i rollen har du:**
* Minst 5+ års erfarenhet av arbete med VMware virtualiseringstekniker.
* Stark förståelse för nätverkskoncept, lagringstekniker och säkerhetsbästa praxis i en virtualiserad miljö
* Djupgående kunskap och erfarenhet av Windows Server-plattformar (2012, 2016, 2019and 2022).
* Erfarenhet av arbete med Linux, Windows servermiljöer och Active Directory.
* Certifieringar som VCP (VMware Certified Professional) och relevanta Microsoft-certifieringar är meriterande.
* Färdighet i skriptning och automation med PowerShell, PowerCLI eller liknande verktyg.
* Förståelse för andra virtualiseringsplattformar som Hyper-V eller KVM.
* Erfarenhet av övervakning och prestandaoptimeringsverktyg.
* Flytande svenska språkkunskaper
* B-körkort.


**Startdatum:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Placeringaort:** 
 Stockholm, Kista
   

  

**Vilka är Fujitsu?**
 Fujitsu är ett världsledande japanskt företag inom IT och kommunikation. Vår marknad bygger på närhet till våra lokala kunder samtidigt som vi har det globala Fujitsu i ryggen. Det ger oss möjlighet att erbjuda alla våra kunder en bred palett av kreativa lösningar samtidigt som det ger oss de rätta verktygen att vara en föregångare inom innovation. Fujitsu erbjuder en komplett portfölj av tjänster, lösningar och produkter – vi är en global partner i den digitala transformationen.
   

  

**Vad kan vi erbjuda?**
 Som medarbetare hos Fujitsu möter du ny och spännande teknik. Artificiell intelligens, IoT, Big Data, Hybrid IT och mycket mer. Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsmiljö med flexibla arbetstider där du får frihet under ansvar att själv lägga upp ditt arbete i ett modernt aktivitetsbaserat kontor. Utöver det får du vara en del av en inkluderande kultur med stark sammanhållning samtidigt som du får se bortom tekniken och fokusera på den konkreta nyttan för våra kunder, för samhället och för miljön.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 På grund av semesterperiod har vi en längre ansökningstid och kommer att vara tillbaka igen i mitten på augusti. Under denna period kommer vi inte kunna behandla ansökningar. Notera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mail, vi uppmuntrar dig att söka via systemet.

title: IT Concept Owner Logistics Management
description:
* Applications are considered on a rolling basis
* Hybrid


**Job Description**
 Are you ready to develop your career in a business where we help to improve millions of people’s health and lives? At Oriola we don’t just offer you a job; we invite you to drive IT and digital innovation forward and to be part of our cultural transformational journey and development of our IT landscape towards a higher profitability and healthy organization.
   

  

**Why joining us at Oriola?** 
 Oriola is a health and wellbeing company operating in the Nordic countries with a mission to become the leading specialist in wholesale of pharmaceutical and health products. As one of the Nordics largest pharmacy wholesalers we are proud to state that we as part of our broad and diversified offer supply near to 100% of all vaccines to the Swedish market.
   

  

 We are driven by our purpose, ‘Health for life’, and are working towards very ambitious sustainability targets to support not only the wellbeing of people, but also the society and our planet.
   

  

 To stay ahead in our market and time, our business is under constant development and transformation in order to be able to continuously provide top notch services within health and wellbeing.
   

  

 During the next few years, a lot is also changing in Oriola's IT landscape. This requires extensive new development and to disruptively rethink the current state. Current technologies are going to fade away just to be replaced by new more modern solutions. This means that several technologies will be living side-by-side for time being but eventually everything will be delivered through common platforms.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 For our Applications Team, we are now looking for an IT Concept Owner, Logistics Management (MM/EWM), with Nordic responsibility, to join our Stockholm, Enköping or Mölnlycke team. You will play an integral role in our solution development and ensure alignment between IT systems and business processes. Your primary focus will be on SAP Materials Management (MM) and/or SAP Warehouse Management (EWM), but you will also work with all relevant 3rd party surrounding systems. You will work in close co-operation with Process Owners, Business Process experts and friendly and driven colleagues in the IT organization as well as external service providers.
   

  

**Primary Responsibilities**
* Strong leadership in Logistics Management design from the IT perspective.
* Design and development of solution based on business and functional needs.
* Translation of complex process and business requirements to technology in order to ensure the best fit to purpose solutions for our business and customers.
* Management of the development backlog and facilitation of prioritization discussions with relevant stakeholders.
* Driving simplicity, template solutions and common architecture.
* Ensuring compliance of regulation and legal requirements.
* Foster support handover to AMS organization.
* Benchmarking and fining new technology trends.
* Yearly action plans and budgets.


**Skills & Requirements**
**Your skills & requirements:**
 Understanding of Logistics Management processes and SAP MM/EWM knowledge.
   

  

 Minimum of a bachelor’s degree and 3+ years of experience as a consultant or an in-house expert. Project management skills would be an advantage.
   

  

 You are used to working with internal and external parties, you are customer oriented and have good interpersonal skills to secure cooperation with different stakeholders. You are a self-propelled and proactive person who can take on and carry responsibility.
   

  

 Fluent spoken and written English is necessary.
   

  

 Work permit and visa are required.
   

  

 The position requires travelling to some extent.
   

  

**We Offer You**
* Great team spirit with friendly colleagues from Sweden and Finland
* A forward leaning and high paced organisation with a higher purpose
* A value driven culture of openness, collaboration, independency and responsibility
* A Scandinavian organization with business travelling within the region
* An interesting and challenging future looking role, that will give you an understanding of the Oriola Group and excellent opportunities for professional growth in a changing business environment


**Terms Of Employment**
* This is a permanent position
* We apply a hybrid job model
* This position is based in Stockholm, Enköping or Mölnlycke


**Application:** 
 If you feel that this is your next career step, please send us your application, CV and salary expectation in English. We will do the interviews continuously, so don’t hesitate to apply. We hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

**Contact:** 
 For further information, please contact
   

  

 Lauri Heinonen, Head of SAP and Core Solution Development,
   

  

 Maria Ardell, Director Applications,
   

  

**If You Want To Learn More About The Company**
**www.oriola.com**

title: Relationship Manager
description:
The Role
   

  

 We are seeking Relationship Manager as part of the Nordic Client Coverage Team. This is an excellent opportunity to join a growing team to develop the business in the Nordics.
   

  

 The Nordic Client Coverage Team manages relationships pre-dominantly with Nordic institutional investors, Insurance companies, Financial Intermediaries, Financial Advisors and Family-Offices.
   

  

 This broad client base has different needs and requirements with regards to the strategies in which they invest both on the liquid side as well as the illiquid side and day-to-day client servicing. The Client Coverage teams are expected to represent the entire Neuberger Berman product suite, with strategies across Equities, Fixed Income and Alternatives.
   

  

**Primary Responsibilities**
* Supporting the local team in their day-to-day client activity and strategic initiatives.
* Managing not only outbound sales, but also inbound sales, with proactive interactions with new or existing leads and follow-ups.
* Liaising and collaborating with colleagues in Portfolio Management, Client Service, Marketing and Compliance teams for client deliverables.
* Organizing prospective client related activity, including but not limited to client presentations. Ensure all activity follows the regulatory framework.
* Conducting market research and assist the team on appropriate business strategies and client analysis.
* CRM maintenance, including database management, producing pipeline activity and meeting notes, to help enhance the overall sales processes.
* Servicing existing client book and respond to all client needs diligently working with the client services team.
* Initiating outbound sales calls and organize client meetings. Prepare new business sales presentations and lead client meetings.
* Working closely with the marketing and client services teams to effectively communicate investment philosophies and processes as coordinating client communications.
* Organizing and proactively supporting client events and marketing collateral efforts.


**Qualifications Needed**
* Degree in economics, management or finance preferred
* At least 3 plus years’ experience in a similar role, preferably within the Asset Management industry. International experience valued.
* Fluency in Swedish is mandatory
* Experience of using Salesforce, or similar CRM system
* Passionate about financial markets
* Excellent presentation skills


 Who you are
   

  

* A self-starter, who works in a precise and timely manner, who can take ownership to move initiatives forward
* Available any day of the week to travel across the Nordics to present NB strategies to different investor bases
* Excellent interpersonal attitude and skills
* Willingness to learn, collaborate and partner across the business
* A strong interest in asset management, financial services, and financial markets
* Strong communication both written and verbal skills and presentation skills
* Strongly numerate with a good working knowledge of Excel
* Strong Working knowledge of PowerPoint


 Career Perspectives
   

  

* You will enjoy working with a growing and dedicated international asset management firm and with a successful and stable sales team.
* This is an excellent opportunity to learn about top fundamental and quantitative investment strategies thanks to regular interaction with proven Portfolio Managers, located around the world.
* You will have the opportunity to be allocated your own clients to contribute to asset raising and provide investment solutions to investors across all Nordic regions.


*Neuberger Berman is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. The Firm and its affiliates do not discriminate in employment because of race, creed, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship status or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact* 
*onlineaccommodations@nb.com* 
*.*
*Learn about the Applicant Privacy Notice (https://www.nb.com/en/global/disclosure-privacy-policy) .*
 Founded in 1939, Neuberger Berman is a private, independent, employee-owned investment manager. From offices in 39 cities worldwide, the firm manages $439 billion in client assets (as of September 30, 2023) across a range of strategies—including equity, fixed income, quantitative and multi-asset class, private equity and hedge funds—on behalf of institutions, advisors and individual investors globally.
   

  

 Tenured, stable and long-term in focus, the firm has built a diverse team—including 700-plus investment professionals and more than 2,700 employees in total—united in their commitment to delivering client outcomes and investment excellence. It is our people who define our culture and have enabled us to be recognized by
 *Pensions & Investments* 
 as the first or second "Best Place to Work in Money Management” for last eight consecutive years (firms with 1,000+ employees).
   

  

 Neuberger Berman believes strongly that all employees are entitled to be treated with respect and dignity, and to work in a professional and safe environment. These values are the cornerstone of our firm. We prohibit any form of harassment, whether mental, verbal or physical. We do not tolerate the support of terrorist groups, acts of terrorism, or threats of violence. All who wish to be employed by the firm are expected to uphold these principles.
   

  

 For important disclosures: http://www.nb.com/linkedin

title: Bli vår nästa stjärna inom nätverk!
description:
Nu söker vi en nätverkstekniker till Stockholms innerstad. Tjänsten börjar som konsultuppdrag men tanken är att anställningen senare ska gå över till kunden.
   

  

 Kunden levererar säkra kommunikationsnätverk och intrångsdetektering för samhällsviktiga aktörer, företag och privatpersoner. Du kommer att få möjligheten att fortsätta utveckla din kompetens inom olika områden och tillhöra en organisation som är under utveckling och tillväxt.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du självklart en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 I rollen som nätverkstekniker kommer du att att arbeta med kvalificerad installation av nätverk till några av Nordens mest dynamiska och snabbväxande industriföretag. Du kommer att arbeta med nätverkssupport där du kommer att ingå i ett team där ni tillsammans supporterar företagets fälttekniker.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 Som person tror vi att du har passion för nätverk och digital säkerhet. Du tar stort ansvar för ditt arbete, är driven och vill lösa de problem som uppstår. Du drivs av att lära dig mer inom cybersäkerhet/informationssäkerhet och är intresserad av att utbilda dig själv under lågintensiva perioder samt snabbt tempoväxla när ett digital angrepp är ett faktum.
   

  

*Krav*
* Minst ett års erfarenhet av digitala nätverk
* Har kunskaper i CCNA
* Flytande i svenska och engelska


*Meriterande*
* Erfarenhet av att vara i serverhallar och arbete i servermiljö
* Ingående förståelse för Linux


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Linköping och Örebro. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Startup Founder - Marketing
description:
At After Class, we're shaking up how teens and parents find and engage in extracurricular activities. Our platform is all about making it easy to discover, book, and enjoy a variety of experiences that help kids grow and thrive. As we gear up for a big fundraising round by the end of 2024, we're on the hunt for passionate founders to join our team. We're looking for hands-on folks who want to help shape the future of our platform. Plus, we're offering equity—meaning you'll get to own a piece of the action and share in our success.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are looking for a dynamic marketing leader to join our founding team. This hands-on role will involve overseeing all aspects of our marketing strategy and execution. You will be responsible for building our brand, driving customer acquisition, and engaging our community.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and implement a comprehensive marketing strategy, including digital, content, and influencer marketing.
* Take full ownership of all marketing activities, from campaign creation to execution and analysis.
* Build and grow our brand presence across various channels, ensuring consistent and compelling messaging.
* Manage the marketing budget and optimize for maximum ROI.
* Collaborate closely with product and tech teams to align marketing initiatives with product launches and updates.



**Qualifications:** 



* Proven experience in digital marketing and brand management, particularly within startups.
* Hands-on experience with social media, SEO, content marketing, and analytics tools.
* Strong creative and analytical skills, with the ability to develop and measure effective campaigns.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.



  





**Join Us:** 
 If you're excited about the opportunity to shape a transformative platform and work with a dedicated team, we want to hear from you. This is more than just a job; it's a chance to build something impactful and own a part of its success. Apply now and become a part of the After Class journey.

title: Medical Advisor Oncology
description:
**Company Description**
 AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.
   

  

**Job Description**
 AbbVie is looking for a Medical Advisor who will work in Sweden with our portfolio in Hematology. The candidate will represent the affiliate’s medical/scientific voice of expertise for assigned product(s) in hematology with a local and Scandinavian scope.
   

  

**Main responsibilities:**
* Establish and maintain professional relationships with experts and academic centers; attend scientific congresses, arrange advisory groups, discussion forums and symposia.
* Deliver scientific presentations and medical education to health professionals.
* Prepare scientific/medical information on request.
* Assist in initiating, supervising and following up evidence generation and medical projects.
* Review and approval of advertising material. Ensure that medical/scientific content is correct and in accordance with regulatory and internal guidelines.
* Be a medical expert in cross-functional teams, and provide medical/scientific input to medical affairs strategies, marketing strategy and commercial initiatives.


**Qualifications**
**The ideal candidate:**
 Join our dynamic team and make a significant impact in the hematology field. We are seeking a candidate with expertise in the assigned therapeutic area and a passion for continuous learning, in addition to a genuine interest in medical research.
   

  

 Collaboration and relationship-building will be at the core of your responsibilities, as you work closely within our matrix organization and key external stakeholders within the healthcare community.
   

  

 Exceptional planning and organizational skills are essential, as you will be responsible for executing tasks efficiently and effectively. Your proven track record in successfully completing assignments will set you apart as an ideal candidate. Additionally, your flexibility and adaptability in navigating ambiguity and embracing change will be crucial in thriving within our organization.
   

  

* Cand. Med., Cand. Pharm., M.Sc., Cand. Scient or equivalent
* Excellent written and spoken communication and presentation skills.
* Fluency in written and oral Swedish.
* Fluency in written and oral English.
* Willingness to travel approximately 50-70% of the time, both national & international.
* Experience in oncology/hematology is an advantage.
* Experience from a medical affairs role in pharma is an advantage
* Experience with
* Clinical experience and solid research experience (PhD) is an advantage.


 Additional Information
   

  

**Next step**
 If you have any questions about this position, please reach out to HoMA Oncology Scandinavia elisabeth.jarnaess@abbvie.com
   

  

**Due to summer vacations, selection and interviews will be held in August/September.**
**Deadline for application is August 31st** 
 .
   

  

 AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status. To learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html (US & Puerto Rico only)

title: Client Manager to Corporate Banking - Energy division Sweden
description:
Our people are the DNA of DNB. Since 1822, bright minds have worked together to find the best solutions for our customers. Today, DNB is much more than Norway’s largest bank, and a key player in the Norwegian economy. We are a technology driven financial institution, constantly adapting our operations and tailoring our services to the time we’re living in and to the future. In DNB, you’ll find a wide range of career opportunities in Norway and internationally. We are among the best companies in the world when it comes to gender equality, and we take good care of the diversity represented by the people who choose to work here.
   

  

 Are you passionate about the energy transition and renewable energy solutions? Are you passionate about developing and maintaining strong relationship between DNB and our existing and future clients? Your strategic approach will involve understanding client needs, ensuring their satisfaction, and identifying opportunities for business growth. We are now looking for an experienced Senior Relationship Manager who will play an important role on this journey, contributing with proactivity, enthusiasm and competence to the team.
   

  

 The Energy Division covers DNB's large customers within Renewable energy, Utilites and Offshore energy. We are approximately 80 people across our offices in Sweden, Norway and Internationally, with the ambition to be the leading financial partner within our segments, focusing on strong industry competence, compliance and sustainability. Cooperation with DNB Markets and other parts of DNB are critical to reach our strategic and financial targets.
   

  

 Energy Division serves clients across the globe and focusing on the entire renewable energy space. We are 10 dedicated Client Managers and Client Advisors in Sweden and Norway working together to serve the Scandinavian market. In Stockholm you will be one of 3-4 Client Managers/Client Advisors working closely with dedicated credit analysts as part of the wider team. The section has a very high deal activity, and we are cooperating closely with DNB Markets (IBD, FICC and Equities) and Working Capital Solutions. We emphasize industry competence and taking advantage of the dynamics of a truly global team.
   

  

 Our ambition is to continue the growth journey that we have started years ago and continue to develop towards becoming a leading Energy bank in Sweden, the Nordics and beyond. In this role you will cooperate with the global team and have an important role in contributing with industry expertise and market knowledge out of the Stockholm office. You will have responsibility for a portfolio of customers and to expand that portfolio with new attractive companies.
   

  

**Your main responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Drive profitable growth through origination of new customers and business opportunities.
* Develop and lead client relationships, including taking a strategic view on the customer’s capital structure, pitching for lending and other cross selling activities and coordinating with the relevant product specialists.
* Ability to execute all kind of transactions, including LBOs, independently and drive a process from pitch to closing.
* Take ownership of the credit risk assessment, structure deals and develop term sheets.
* Take responsibility of the documentation process of a deal, including reviewing loan agreements and coordinating stakeholders.
* Develop and maintain strong industry knowledge, which includes broadening networks with relevant industry participants
* Possess and continuously develop strong industry knowledge.
* Have a hands-on oversight of KYC procedures and non-financial risk assessments.


**Competence requirements:**
* Higher academic education in business or equivalent
* Fluent in spoken and written English. To know Swedish ( both written and spoken) is a great advantageous
* In-depth knowledge of large corporate banking products, capital markets and capital-efficient solutions
* Relevant experience and good business understanding.
* Ability to initiate and build relationships both external and internal.
* Pro-active, structured and result-oriented.


**Personal qualities:**
 You possess good inter-personal and communication skills and can promote, leverage and maintain internal/external networks. You are an advocate of change and innovation and should strive to find process improvements and promote innovation wherever possible.
   

  

**We offer**
 DNB strives to create a workplace where people thrive and feel safe. We believe that equality and inclusion boost innovative thinking and collective competency which contributes to create an attractive and flexible company equipped for a changeable business landscape.
   

  

 Our premises are centrally located in Stockholm and we apply “hybrid work place”.
   

  

**Application** 
  

  

 Please send in your application no later than 20th of August 2024.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the position, please reach out to Client Advisor Niklas Johansson, niklas.johansson@dnb.se . If you have questions regarding you application and process, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner, Sofia Elgstedt, sofia.elgstedt@dnb.se
   

  

**We are looking forward receiving your application!**
 Local Trade union:
   

  

 Finansförbundet: Hasse Sigfrids, hasse.sigfrids@dnb.se
   

  

 Akademikerförbunden: Charlotte,  charlotte.lofgren@dnb.se
   

  

 As a qualitative part of DNB’s recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the work environment, and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/
   

  

 In this job application process, you only need to upload your resume (CV). Cover letter is not required but you can upload this under attachments if desired.
   

  

 As an employer DNB is encouraging all kind of internal mobility such as recruitment, job rotation, special assignments etc. This is an opportunity for you to take on a new career challenge within the company and get valuable personal and competence development. Some open positions are only published internally and can only be applied for by employees and consultants at DNB.
   

  

 When applying for a position it is only the hiring manager and HR who have access to your application.

title: Director Carrier Wholesale NO
description:
**Director Carrier Wholesale**
*Do you have a strategic leadership background and a keen interest in the telecommunications field? Do you thrive in high-paced environments and enjoy creating significant business opportunities?* 
*Step into the position of Director Carrier Wholesale in GlobalConnect and become a vital part of our journey towards organizational advancement and growth.*
 As the Director Carrier Wholesale in GlobalConnect, you will be at the forefront of our telecommunications wholesale division. This role is crucial in developing and executing strategies that maximize revenue from carrier services, including fiber and dark fiber. You will work closely with other telecom companies and hyperscalers, creating and maintaining essential connections that take our business forward.
   

  

***In this role you can be located in any of our headquarters in Stockholm, Oslo or Copenhagen.***
**Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:**
* Building and maintaining positive relationships with key customers and industry stakeholders.
* Expanding market opportunities and enhancing sales performance with our sales team.
* Gathering and analyzing data across different countries to identify trends and opportunities.
* Ensuring seamless coordination between various departments to meet sales targets and deliver exceptional customer service.


**Why Join Us?**
 Joining our team means becoming part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation and growth. You will have the opportunity to work with large telecom companies and hyperscalers, handling high-value transactions that have a significant impact on our business. You will have the chance to attend industry events across Europe, expanding your network and staying ahead of market trends.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe you have:**
* Extensive experience in sales and business development within the telecom industry.
* An understanding of corporate finance and revenue generation.
* Proficiency in English; additional Scandinavian language skills is an added bonus.
* The ability to gather and analyze data, and translate it into actionable business strategies together with presentation skills.


 We welcome your application, placing value on your motivation and enthusiasm, even if you haven't fulfilled every criterion. You find purpose in the task of developing and ensuring the continuous advancement of the company. You enjoy working with people and are not easily stressed by constant change. You thrive in environments where you can make a significant impact and are motivated by achieving ambitious targets. Join us and be part of a team that values innovation, growth, and making a significant impact in the telecommunications industry.
   

  

 Apply today and embark on an exciting career journey with us!

title: Senior Business Analyst for Transaction Monitoring Change Management
description:
**Job ID: 25424** 






  

  



 At Nordea, we have the responsibility to society and our customers to prevent financial products and services from being used for unlawful purposes.  
 







  
 







 Would you like to work on topics of strategic importance for Nordea’s Financial Crime Prevention Area? We are currently looking for you, a Senior Business Analyst to play an important part in working on our Anti-Money Laundering solution for Capital Markets and Trade Finance products. 
   

  





**About this opportunity**




 Welcome to Transaction Monitoring Change Management. We are a best-in-class people organization that supports Nordea’s strategic agenda by attracting, retaining and growing Senior Business Analyst Professionals.    As the Senior Business Analyst, you will work on a programme level, designing and implementing solutions that bring value to Nordea on a journey to detect and prevent financial crime. We are a team of international proactive and professional individuals that are working with cutting edge technology.   
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Practice agile principles and work in an agile framework
* Work together with business stakeholders to translate high level business demand into more concrete features and user stories, and align on the prioritization
* Put your technical skills to good use to explore options for - and help shape - the best solutions that create customer value
* Extract knowledge and understandable insights from data in various forms, and facilitate data driven decision making
* Be a proactive facilitator in getting the right people together
* Network effectively to get to know your stakeholders in the organization
* Deliver best-in-class solutions for transaction monitoring



  

  



 You’ll join a Transaction Monitoring Change Management unit team in our Stockholm metropolitan area where you will continuously develop your skills within Business Analysis and Transaction Monitoring. You will be assigned to an agile development hub and be a part of a cross-functional agile team, working towards a shared business purpose. 
   

  

 Here at Nordea, we believe that technology alone is never the solution. People are. 
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Are driven by value creation from idea to implementation, by always having the customer in focus
* Have strong communication and stakeholder management skills, and can build a bridge between people, technology and different business areas
* Have a strong solution-oriented and analytical mindset with the ability to see both the big picture, as well as the underlying details
* Are genuinely interested in working with architectural solution options and technical deliveries including different kind of integrations
* Have extensive experience working with multiple project deliveries within tight deadlines and you are comfortable dealing with ambiguity
* And should it arise, you are adept at bringing order out of chaos
* Are proactive and self-driven person who wants to get things done
* Are passionate about learning and putting your knowledge into practice to deliver concrete results



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 
  
 




* You have a minimum of 5 years’ experience working as a Senior Business Analyst
* You have an excellent business orientation and understanding of the financial industry with extended experience in Business Analysis, Product Management, IT Product Development or similar
* You have experience in requirement elicitation and analysis with a high level of competence in communicating requirements in a clear and concise manner using presentation and visualization tools
* You are proactive, self-driven and collaborate well with multiple stakeholders at all levels
* You have extensive experience (minimum 5 years) in Agile ways of working and related methodologies (e.g. SAFe, Scrum, Agile-Lean) and have a high level understanding of Agile SAFe
* You preferably have experience in financial crime prevention and/or transaction monitoring with focus on data and related products
* You have experience working with agile project management tools, for example Jira and Confluence
* You are fluent in written and spoken English



  

  



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Please submit your application, which must include your CV and cover letter no later than 18/08/2024
 



 . 
 







  
 







 During the month of July, we are mostly on vacation and will look forward to going through the applications in the order in which they were received when we return in August. 
 





  
 





 For more information, you’re welcome to contact Andrew Robertson via email andrew.robertson-2@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Senior/Expert Data Governance Expert to Group Data Management
description:
**Job ID: 24435** 






  
 





 We are looking for a Senior/Expert Data Governance Expert for full-time employment agreement to continuously drive and support in securing high quality metadata capabilities, meeting the data governance needs of our stakeholders across the Group. 
 





  
 





**About our team** 






  
 





 Meet the Data Governance & Metadata Management (team name) team. Our role is to exercise a broad range of responsibilities including definition and maintenance of Group level policies and operating models, coordination, training and advisory, and metadata management to enable Nordea to take responsibility for, and gain value from data. 
 





  
 





 Our team is located in Group Business Support, Group Data Management and consists of experts in various fields of data governance where we all have a role as organizational change ambassadors, supporting the alignment and implementation of the DG Framework i.e. people, processes and technology coming to place in a good way. We are currently a team of approximately dozen experts and are looking to grow a bit. We have one or several employees in all the four Nordic countries and Poland
 





  
 





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.  
 





  
 





**What you’ll be doing** 






  
 





**Main responsibilities in this role:** 





* Identify, design, develop and implement efficient and effective metadata management processes and operational instructions that support to continuously maintain high meta data quality
* Engage in and develop training and knowledge sharing for practitioners using metadata services enabling them becoming a subject matter expert
* Hands-on support to the metadata owners and users by managing metadata in the services
* Develop and implement relevant monitoring and controlling processes to pursue implementation according to internal policies and relevant regulations
* As a member of DG&MM team you will also have opportunities to contribute and collaborate broadly across our area of responsibility



  
 





 The role is based in Helsinki, Gdynia, Gdansk or Stockholm.
 





  
 





**Who you are** 






  
 





**This is the right role for you if:** 





* You are passionate about business meaning of data, understand metadata and its role in enabling world class financial services.
* You are a driver with positive energy, persistent with your goals, good in building effective networks and have shown your ability to act as interpreter between business and IT. You express opinions, and key points of an argument clearly to convey your message to different audiences.
* You are proactively proposing new ideas, approaches and insights and you continuously seek opportunities for organisational improvement.
* You are able to work independently while you’re a true team-player
* It would be perfect if you’ve worked with metadata in some context, particularly in financial industry, but we’re above all observing your eagerness to learn more and solid ability to communicate with a service-minded attitude
* You develop job knowledge and expertise through continuous professional development and have keen interest and ability on sharing knowledge with others



  
 





**Your background and skills include:** 





* Previous work experience in data governance and data quality, controlling/reporting and/or projects as e.g. senior analyst
* Experience in process documentation or process development and training others
* You have professional level fluency, both written and spoken, in English language. Proficiency in Nordic languages is a definite advantage
* While we prefer a university degree in technology or business, the full combination of you is that will matter the most





**It would be ideal if you also:** 





* Have experience with IBM InfoSphere Suite: Information Governance Catalog, Information Analyzer and/or Orion Governance: EIIG
* Well familiarized into using MS-Office tools



  
 





 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
 





  
 





**A culture that fosters performance and growth** 
 in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
 





  
 





**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility. 
 





  
 





**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
 





  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 16/08/2024
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Hannu Pertti Tapani Pitkänen.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





 If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.
 





  
 





**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.** 






  
 





**We build relationships** 
 . We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
 

  
 





**We learn and develop** 
 . We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges. 
 

  
 





**We lead change** 
 . We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy. 
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Poland: Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following: 
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
